summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing the drafting of a 5K letter for an inmate named Forte. The correspondence concerns whether the inmate's account was critical to charging their case, the likelihood of calling him as a witness, and the sensitivity of referencing an Office of the Inspector General (OIG) investigation.

persons.name: Forte
persons.context: An inmate who provided an account that may be important background for an OIG report. The prosecutors are discussing whether his information was critical to charging their case and if he might be needed as a witness.

events.title: Email discussion on Forte 5K letter
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys correspond about drafting a 5K letter for an inmate named Forte, discussing the relevance of his account to their case and an OIG investigation.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were preparing a 5K letter for an inmate named Forte, which is a motion for a reduced sentence based on substantial assistance.
The inmate's account was not relied upon for charging the prosecutors' case and it is highly unlikely he would be called as a witness.
The inmate's account is expected to be important background for a future Office of the Inspector General (OIG) report.
The email chain shows internal deliberation about what information can be included in the 5K letter, specifically regarding the secrecy of an OIG investigation.
